meanings.definition: To bestow something in generous or extravagant quantities.
meanings.sent1: She was lavishing praise on her friend for the amazing artwork.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy businessman enjoys lavishing gifts on his family during the holidays.
meanings.sent3: The magician was lavishing the audience with an endless supply of colorful scarves.
meanings.sent4: The sun was lavishing the earth with its warm rays, bringing life to the plants.
meanings.sent5: The chef was lavishing the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs, enhancing the flavors.

meanings.definition: To expend or give in great amounts.
meanings.sent1: The company was lavishing resources on the new marketing campaign.
meanings.sent2: She was lavishing attention on her pet cat, making sure it felt loved.
meanings.sent3: The child was lavishing his allowance on candy, much to his dentist's dismay.
meanings.sent4: The storm was lavishing the town with rain, causing flooding in the streets.
meanings.sent5: The artist was lavishing paint on the canvas, creating a vibrant masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: He was lavishing his time on volunteering at the local shelter.
meanings.sent2: The philanthropist was lavishing donations on various charities around the world.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was lavishing praise on the students for their hard work.
meanings.sent4: The gardener was lavishing care on the delicate flowers in the greenhouse.
meanings.sent5: The baker was lavishing frosting on the cake, making it look irresistible.
